info.title: Hypersender SMS API Docs
info.description:
Send and receive sms messages, with Hypersender SMS API. This Documentation provides a comprehensive guide to the API, including detailed information on how to send and receive sms messages, controll message threads, and monitor phone heartbeats.

**How it works**

To use the API, you need to have the Hypersender app installed on your android phone. The app will receive the messages and send them to the recipient.

**Download the app**

You can download it from the release page on [github](https://github.com/hypersender/sms-app-releases/releases).

**How to use the app**

- Download the app from the release page.

- Install the app on your android phone.

- Grant the app the necessary permissions, see the [permissions](https://docs.hypersender.com/docs/hypersender/overview/sms-quick-start#step-4-download-the-hypersender-sms-app), section for more information.

- Open the app, and scan the QR code to link the app with the API.

- The app will start receiving messages, and then send them to the recipient.


<hr />

**Quick Demo**

  **Learn how to use Hypersender SMS API to send a message using Postman:**
  [Demo Link](https://app.hypersender.com/send-sms-message-in-postman) **to easily interact with our API.**

<hr />

**postman collection**

You can download our [Postman Collection](https://docs.hypersender.com/sms-postman-collection.json) to easily interact with our API.

content.description: The content of your SMS message, keep it short and sweet because sms messages done like to be short!

request_id.description: any string preferably uuid that you can use later to find this message.

to.description:
phone number that you want to send the message to.
Make sure that it start with + and have country code example: +203123131313

schedule_send_at.description: optional date in the future max: 3 days that the message will be sent Relative to your defined Timezone! Example: 2025-01-08 19:47:00

max_send_attempts.description: How many times I should retry sending this message when it fails to be sent, Max: 15 times.

message_expiration_seconds.description: How many seconds this message is valid for, this is usefull when you are sending OTPs with expiration of 2 mins.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

post.description:
## Send Message

Send a new SMS message to be sent by your android phone, you can schedule it up to 3 days in the future relative to your definied phone timezone.

you can also specifiy an unique request id that you can use later to search for this message.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: number of messages per page, max: 50

parameters.name: filter[app_version]
parameters.description: filter by the android application version that was installed on your phone

parameters.name: filter[battery_level]
parameters.description: filter by percentage of the battery

parameters.name: filter[is_charging]
parameters.description: filter by wither the phone was charging or not

parameters.name: filter[local_timestamp]
parameters.description: get heartbeats by the local time of the phone

parameters.name: filter[created_at]
parameters.description: filter by when the heartbeat was created on the system.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: default: -created_at, you can sort by any date: 'created_at', 'local_timestamp'

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: include the phone object with the heartbeat, possible values: phone

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: when paginating use this property to navigate through pages, example: page=2, page=1 and so on..

get.description:
## Heartbeats

Index heartbeats of the phone sorted by last heartbeat.

You can filter by various attributes, and this endpoint is paginated.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: number of messages per page, max: 50

parameters.name: filter[request_id]
parameters.description: user defined string that can retrive message by it

parameters.name: filter[message_thread_id]
parameters.description: the thread id of the message

parameters.name: filter[from_phone_number]
parameters.description: message that was sent/recived from phone specified number

parameters.name: filter[to_phone_number]
parameters.description: message that was sent/recivied from phone specified number

parameters.name: filter[content]
parameters.description: search by parts of the message

parameters.name: filter[status]
parameters.description: pending, scheduled, sending, sent, failed, received, delivered, expired, deleted

parameters.name: filter[type]
parameters.description: sent, received, call_missed

parameters.name: filter[delivered_at]
parameters.description: filter by delivery date range down to the minute, comma seprated, example: 2025-01-01 00:00:00,2025-01-01 00:20:00

parameters.name: filter[received_at]
parameters.description: filter by received date range down to the minute, comma seprated, example: 2025-01-01 00:00:00,2025-01-01 00:20:00

parameters.name: filter[expired_at]
parameters.description: filter by expired date range down to the minute, comma seprated, example: 2025-01-01 00:00:00,2025-01-01 00:20:00

parameters.name: filter[failed_at]
parameters.description: filter by failed date range down to the minute, comma seprated, example: 2025-01-01 00:00:00,2025-01-01 00:20:00

parameters.name: filter[schedule_send_at]
parameters.description: filter by when the message will be sent date range down to the minute, comma seprated, example: 2025-01-01 00:00:00,2025-01-01 00:20:00

parameters.name: filter[created_at]
parameters.description: filter by when the message was created on the system. Note: this is not the date of message sent or received.

parameters.name: filter[updated_at]
parameters.description: filter by when the message was last updated.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: default: -updated_at, you can sort by any date: 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'delivered_at', 'received_at', 'expired_at', 'failed_at', 'schedule_send_at'

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: include the phone or messageThread object with the message, possible values: phone,messageThread

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: when paginating use this property to navigate through pages, example: page=2, page=1 and so on..

message_thread.last_message_content: 2جيجا هدية.ليك منهم 200 ميجا فيسبوك ليومين عشان انت 4G. كلم#221*

data.content: 2جيجا هدية.ليك منهم 200 ميجا فيسبوك ليومين عشان انت 4G. كلم#221*

get.description:
## Index Messages

This endpoint will index all of the messages sent and recevied based on various criteria, including searching my request id and messages attributes, with paging limited to 50 messages per response. Default sort is by last updated_at.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

delete.description:
## Delete Message

Delete a message from the database and removes the message content from the list of threads.

parameters.name: per_page
parameters.description: number of messages per page, max: 50

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: default: -updated_at, you can sort by any date: 'created_at', 'last_message_at', 'updated_at'

parameters.name: filter[last_message_content]
parameters.description: filter by last message content.

parameters.name: filter[is_archived]
parameters.description: filter by SMS messages based on their archived status.

parameters.name: filter[last_message_id]
parameters.description: get the thread where the thread is the specified message id

parameters.name: filter[from_or_to_number]
parameters.description: get the thread where the "from" or "to" of phone number

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: include the phone or messageThread object with the message, possible values: phone, messageThread

Example 1.last_message_content: اشترك الآن في أجدع شحنه 26.6 واحصل علي 1,300 وحده تستخدمهم في المكالمات الصوتيه و الانترنت ب 26.6 جنيه صالحه لمدة 14 يوم. للإشتراك اتصل ب #566* او زور تطبيق MyWE

data.last_message_content:
مبروك ليك 20 وحدة هدية
رد ب 1 الاّن!
و اشتراك اول يوم علينا
و فرصتك تلعب و تكسب 50,000جنيه
اشترك في GamezZe بـ5جنيه لليوم 
رد ب 1 الاّن

get.description:
## Message Threads

This endpoint will index all of the contacts which a phone number has communicated with (threads). with paging limited to 50 messages per response. It will be sorted by updated_at in descending order.

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

put.description:
## Edit Message Thread

Edit message thread archived status

is_archived.description: Specifies whether the message thread should be marked as archived.

messageThreadId.description: Specifies the message thread id you want to be archived

parameters.name: instance
parameters.description: Instance UUID copied from hypersender dashboard

delete.description:
## Delete Message threads

Delete a message thread from the database and also deletes all the messages in the thread.

:::warning

Deleting a thread will delete all of the messages related to the thread.

:::

sim.description:
SIM is the SIM card to use to send the message

SMS1: use the SIM card in slot 1
SMS2: use the SIM card in slot 2
sim.default: used the default communication SIM card

message_thread.last_message_content: 2جيجا هدية.ليك منهم 200 ميجا فيسبوك ليومين عشان انت 4G. كلم#221*
